Key Match Events: Luis Suarez scored a dramatic stoppage-time equalizer for Uruguay to force the match into a penalty shootout.
Ismael Kone scored an acrobatic overhead kick for Canada.
Jonathan David scored a rebound goal for Canada in the 80th minute.
Uruguay won the penalty shootout 4-3 after Alphonso Davies missed a Panenka attempt.
Rodrigo Bentancur smashed in a knock-down from a corner to put Uruguay ahead.
Luis Suarez scored a penalty in the shootout to give Uruguay the lead.
Canada were on the verge of winning bronze but Suarez's equalizer sent the match to penalties.
Pre-Game Insights: Marcelo Bielsa described the tournament as 'unprofessional',
Jesse Marsch claimed his side has been treated like'second-class' citizens.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada should hold their heads high despite the disappointing loss.
Uruguay come third at 2024 Copa America.
Alphonso Davies missed a Panenka attempt to hand victory to Uruguay.
Luis Suarez was the hero for Uruguay, scoring a dramatic stoppage-time equalizer and a penalty in the shootout.
Uruguay held their nerve in the penalty shootout to win third place.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada finished the highest of all the guest nations invited to compete at the U.S. Copa America.
The team that finishes third at Copa America receives $5 million and the fourth $4 million.
The match was a lively encounter with two former Leeds United coaches' pre-match comments adding to the tension.
Uruguay were the overwhelming favorites to win in Charlotte.
